subject: Re: Tenable WAS Findings (November 2025)
preview: Link: https://secure.helpscout.net/conversation/3164346952  New reply passing to @adriane for handling and training

full_threads.body:
Link: https://secure.helpscout.net/conversation/3164346952

New reply passing to @adriane for handling and training

Hi Allie,

I have run a remediation scan last weekend and the results still show the findings. I have attached the reports of one of the affected webapp in this email for your reference.

Appreciate if you could look into it. Thanks.

Richard Ho
Cyber Security Analyst The Envest Group



richard.ho@envest.com.au

Visit: envest.com.au
Follow us:





This e-mail and any attachments are CONFIDENTIAL and may contain legally privileged information. If you are not the intended recipient of this e-mail message, please telephone or e-mail us immediately, delete this message from your system and do not read, copy, distribute, disclose or otherwise use this e-mail message and any attachments. Hi Richard,

Thanks for the update.

No worries at all, we’ll leave avisogroup.com.au in your hands to sort out with your other team.
regarding the rest of the Envest
  • All other websites managed by us have been successfully patched and hardened against the risks you flagged.
  • You are now clear to proceed with your remediation scan on those sites to verify the fixes.

Give us a shout if anything else pops up on the report.

Always happy to help 😊

Hi Allie,

Thanks for the clarification. You can ignore avisogroup.com.au. Will get someone else to implement the fixes.

Richard Ho
Cyber Security Analyst The Envest Group



richard.ho@envest.com.au

Visit: envest.com.au
Follow us:





This e-mail and any attachments are CONFIDENTIAL and may contain legally privileged information. If you are not the intended recipient of this e-mail message, please telephone or e-mail us immediately, delete this message from your system and do not read, copy, distribute, disclose or otherwise use this e-mail message and any attachments. Although The Envest Group believe this e-mail and any attachments to be free of any virus or other defect which may affect your computer, it is the responsibility of the recipient to ensure that it is virus free and The Envest Group does not accept any responsibility for any loss of damage arising in any way from its use.

Hi Richard,

We’ve had a closer look at the avisogroup.com.au setup, and it looks like this particular site isn't built on WordPress. It appears to be a Next.js application hosted on Azure.

Because it’s sitting outside our managed environment, we can't apply the server-side fixes directly through our  tools.

However, we have a couple of ways we can help you get this sorted:
  • We can implement the fix: While our core specialisation is high-performance WordPress environments, our team is technically versatile and happy to assist here. We can jump into your Azure/Next.js setup and apply the necessary security headers. Just keep in mind that as this sits slightly outside our standard stack, it might take a little longer for us to navigate than a typical request.
  • Rebuild in WordPress: Alternatively, if you're open to it, we could discuss rebuilding this site in WordPress. This would bring avisogroup.com.au under our fully managed umbrella, ensuring it benefits from the same 24/7 security monitoring, speed optimisations, and reliability as your other Envest sites.

Technical Details for Your Team: If you prefer to have an internal developer handle the current setup, here is the exact technical fix they need to apply to resolve the Medium (HSTS) and Low risks flagged in the report.

The most robust way to fix these vulnerabilities is to add the security headers directly in the application configuration

module.exports = {
 async headers() {
   return [
     {
       source: '/:path*',
       headers: [
         {
           key: 'Strict-Transport-Security',
           value: 'max-age=63072000; includeSubDomains; preload' // Fixes "Permissive HSTS" (Medium Risk)
         },
         {
           key: 'X-Frame-Options',
           value: 'SAMEORIGIN' // Fixes Clickjacking risk (Low Risk)
         },
         {
           key: 'X-Content-Type-Options',
           value: 'nosniff' // Fixes MIME sniffing risk (Low Risk)
         },
         {
           key: 'Referrer-Policy',
           value: 'strict-origin-when-cross-origin'
         }
       ],
     },
   ]
 },
}

Additional Azure Option: If modifying the code isn't an immediate option, and you are using Azure Front Door or an Azure Application Gateway, you can often configure these headers ("Response Headers") directly in the Azure portal under the routing rules.
  • https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/frontdoor/front-door-security-headers
  • https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/application-gateway/rewrite-http-headers-portal

Cookies (Low Risk) For the "Cookie Without Secure/HttpOnly Flag" warnings: please ensure that wherever cookies are being set in the code (e.g., authentication tokens), the secure: true and httpOnly: true attributes are explicitly defined.

Always happy to help 😊

Hi Allie,

Sure thing. Can you share with me the details on what needs to be changed?

Richard Ho
Cyber Security Analyst The Envest Group



richard.ho@envest.com.au

Visit: envest.com.au
Follow us:

Hi Richard,

Thanks for getting back to us so quickly.

To give you an immediate update: we have successfully implemented the security fixes for the majority of the websites based on the findings in your report.

However, we have hit a bit of a blocker with avisogroup.com.au. Currently, this domain isn't pointed to our managed Kinsta (it appears to be hosted via Azure). As long as it is off-server, we are unable to apply the specific server-side security hardening required to resolve the risks you flagged.

To fix this, are you able to update the DNS records to point the site back to our IP?

Once the domain is propagating to our server, I can apply the final security tweaks immediately.

Let me know if you have any trouble with those records, and I'll keep an eye out for the change.

Hi Allie,

Thanks for replying to my email.

Noted. When will you be able to get back to me on this once it's done?

Richard Ho
Cyber Security Analyst
The Envest Group


richard.ho@envest.com.au

Visit: envest.com.au
Follow us:

Hi Richard,

We will look into the findings detected from Tenable WAS on the Envest websites for November 2025 and focus on remediating the issues of Critical, High, Medium, and Low risks.

Once the necessary updates and fixes have been made, we will get back to you so you can proceed with a remediation scan to verify the findings have been fixed.

Always happy to help 😊

full_threads.body:
Dear Team,

Attached are the findings detected from Tenable WAS on Envest websites for November 2025. Kindly focus to remediate findings which are of Critical, High, Medium and Low risks.

Do get back to me once it's done so I can proceed with a remediation scan to verify the findings have been fixed. Thank you.
Richard Ho
Cyber Security Analyst
The Envest Group
